Description of incident: Sometime around April 11, 2013, Dr. Whisman learned of a breach that involved patient information on a computer recovered during an identity theft ring investigation.  The patient information included full names, Social Security numbers, addresses, telephone numbers, dates of birth, and insurance plan information for patients who were seen in 1998 and 1999.  The information likely came from a stolen computer and Dr. Whisman was encouraged to delay notification until the investigation was completed.
